channel.title: New additions to the forum
channel.description:
Firstly, the Moparscape Staff Team is happy to announce the newest addition to our staff team: amy_webb! She'll be moderating the RS Models & Requests sections. We're sure that she'll be a great addition to the team. :)
We would also like to announce the addition of the new MoparClassic board. You may find more information about what MoparClassic is [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,648686.0.html]here[/url].

item.title: New additions to the forum
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Well, this thread has progressed further than was needed. I can assure all of you that everything was considered when we chose Amy as a sectional moderator. If we did not think that she could deliver on the job, then she would not have been chosen in the first place.

And as David said, any implication that we chose her because of her gender is absolute rubbish. It’s absolutely ridiculous that it was even brought up and then further believed.

Read full topic

item.title: New additions to the forum
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:39, topic:530020”]I very much doubt it has anything to do with making someone a global X months later. First of all because I doubt they would think that far in advance, and secondly because if they wanted to make someone a global they could do it right away anyways. There is no rule saying they need to be a sectional first. From my experience in the staff section, I’m going to guess the conversation went something like this:

New Topic - “amy_webb for sectional in modeling section?”
Replies consisting of: “looks good”, “good contributions”, “cant see why not”, “looks like a decent attitude”

And then given sectional. I would bet that it wasn’t even brought up or thought much of that the section wouldn’t need much moderation.

(And I am not even going to respond to the idea that this had anything to do with gender, that’s outrageous on many levels, first one being the G.I.R.L internet theorem)[/quote]David I rarely agree with you mate but rep++ on everything literally.

One thing I would like to note though I think it was one of the admins who mentioned once that you should consider sectional as a “trial” position? Or maybe that was one of the other gmods who said that I am unsure I know I heard it somewhere.

And for the poster who questioned Amy’s gender… dude she’s a chick I have actually talked to her over skype before…

Read full topic

item.title: New additions to the forum
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

didn’t think people would take my post seriously, I was honestly messing around, I love Amy and I doubt it was the reason I posted (Which didn’t get removed, by the way). If anything, you can look at David’s post because that’s honestly how it probably went and usually goes.
No one really thinks ahead or puts a valid thought into their post anymore, rarely.

Read full topic

item.title: New additions to the forum
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

amy_webb:

We’re not given a reason to why, so to whoever wasn’t involved in the decision it is guesswork. I wouldn’t take your word on it, just because you give trolls power that doesn’t mean they’ll stop. I believe they would use there power as an advantage to themselves rather then to help the community. You should not assume things, global moderator is a lot more work then a sectional moderator and it is a lot more pressure. In 6 months time i might not be on the forum any more, life works in mysterious ways. You haven’t touched any nerves, i just thought it should be addressed considering the amount of complaints on the thread. I don’t exactly understand what you meant by “you and anyone that supports you”, but i hope you aren’t insinuating that there is going to be a “for or against amy” problem starting on the forum.

I wasn’t insinuating some sort of red vs blue type of war at all, like I said I was dead serious. But, you tell me not to assume yet just before you wrote that you assume that my assumption was a bad one or by more as the wrong one at the same time as assuming that they will use it to their own evil advantage. I guess the assumption of the following metaphor, if you assume you make an ass out of u and me is quite true.

But don’t forget, I had already given up on any promotions so be as it is, get global. I just like a good debate.

Read full topic

item.title: New additions to the forum
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I very much doubt it has anything to do with making someone a global X months later. First of all because I doubt they would think that far in advance, and secondly because if they wanted to make someone a global they could do it right away anyways. There is no rule saying they need to be a sectional first. From my experience in the staff section, I’m going to guess the conversation went something like this:

New Topic - “amy_webb for sectional in modeling section?”
Replies consisting of: “looks good”, “good contributions”, “cant see why not”, “looks like a decent attitude”

And then given sectional. I would bet that it wasn’t even brought up or thought much of that the section wouldn’t need much moderation.

(And I am not even going to respond to the idea that this had anything to do with gender, that’s outrageous on many levels, first one being the G.I.R.L internet theorem)

Read full topic

item.title: New additions to the forum
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

We’re not given a reason to why, so to whoever wasn’t involved in the decision it is guesswork. I wouldn’t take your word on it, just because you give trolls power that doesn’t mean they’ll stop. I believe they would use there power as an advantage to themselves rather then to help the community. You should not assume things, global moderator is a lot more work then a sectional moderator and it is a lot more pressure. In 6 months time i might not be on the forum any more, life works in mysterious ways. You haven’t touched any nerves, i just thought it should be addressed considering the amount of complaints on the thread. I don’t exactly understand what you meant by “you and anyone that supports you”, but i hope you aren’t insinuating that there is going to be a “for or against amy” problem starting on the forum.

Read full topic

item.title: New additions to the forum
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:36, topic:530020”]Tabby, obviously you’re frustrated with the way the staff on the forum is working at the moment but i think you’re being very close minded about the whole thing like a lot of others who’ve posted here. Maybe i was asked to be a sectional mod because they want an excuse to have a reason for a female staff member but that was up to the staff. There are a few people who have been around mopar for awhile now and all they do is troll or help friends, would you want someone like that to be a mod? I mean they may have more knowledge and experience but are they using it effectively? It isn’t about what you have it is about how you use it, that is it.

As for everyone saying that they gave me this as a reason to give me global in a few months time, who is to say i’ll accept it? They offer you a position, they don’t force it upon you which means it is a decision of both parties. However, if you have a problem i suggest taking it to an admin because complaining publicly won’t change anything but your warning level by the looks of your opinion.[/quote]
Maybe isn’t good enough lady. The other highlighted part is the only valid excuse I think is acceptable, though I had already planned ahead that someone would’ve said that days ago when this topic was first made and yes some of them do act like trolls but put them in a position of authority and I assure you they will change drastically, I bet you. And please, don’t act like you wouldn’t accept a global position, you’ve accepted the sectional position so why would being global be any different right? I like to think I touched a few nerves writing that post which I think I did but it was meant to be on a serious note in which I hope you and anyone that supports you takes it as.

Read full topic

item.title: New additions to the forum
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Tabby, obviously you’re frustrated with the way the staff on the forum is working at the moment but i think you’re being very close minded about the whole thing like a lot of others who’ve posted here. Maybe i was asked to be a sectional mod because they want an excuse to have a reason for a female staff member but that was up to the staff. There are a few people who have been around mopar for awhile now and all they do is troll or help friends, would you want someone like that to be a mod? I mean they may have more knowledge and experience but are they using it effectively? It isn’t about what you have it is about how you use it, that is it.

As for everyone saying that they gave me this as a reason to give me global in a few months time, who is to say i’ll accept it? They offer you a position, they don’t force it upon you which means it is a decision of both parties. However, if you have a problem i suggest taking it to an admin because complaining publicly won’t change anything but your warning level by the looks of your opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: New additions to the forum
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:34, topic:530020”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=648777.msg4366668#msg4366668 date=1379808078]
Everyone making sexual jokes because it’s a female.
[/quote]
“it’s”. 1990 classic horror film It.

On a serious note. Will probably get a warning or at the very most a ban for this but it’s about time someone had to say this. I’ve just given up on staff promotions, I see staff being promoted by traits and not skill level nor experience. I’ve been here non-stop for nearly 5 years now and I have never seen a more prominent flaw in Moparscape since now. Maybe its just me missing those jack ass but knowledgeable mitbers so it’s not really much to discuss on my behalf. Though, there was originally no spam, arguing or reason for there to be a moderator on the model section so the only conclusion I can come up with is… well the post was removed but it said something along the lines of this, “they just needed a reason to give her global within 6 months.” Meaning some people are looking to get their e-dick hard on.[/quote]
rep++

Read full topic
